storyInfo: After the final battle, victory is secured and the Steam Knight's mission is complete. Allerdale bids farewell to Vina before vanishing into the steam. Vina faces the dukes to address Londinium's many issues.

attributes.text: 'Victory'.
\nIn the boxing ring, victory is about honor and glory.
\nOn the battlefield, victory is about lives saved...and lost.
The Nachzehrer King's death terrified everyone who saw it. I don't want to think about it now, much less include it in my book.
\nThat Sarkaz won't get a eulogy from me.
\nBut, I'll forever honor the last Steam Knight, Sir Charles Lynch.

attributes.content: .....How long has it been since he's moved?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Ten minutes.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: No one dares approach Charles Lynch.
Everyone gathers around the last Steam Knight, down on one knee in a show of respect.
He stands tall and unwavering before the Palace of Westhaleg, steam gushing from every crack in his armor.
Scorching, unrelenting.
Like the sound of a beating heart.
How can he still be standing with such grievous wounds from the battle with the Nachzehrer king...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: It was never his body alone that kept him upright, or he would have never made it out of the Mausoleum of Kings.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina walks towards the Steam Knight, as everyone else watches on.
Vina, don't get close to him. He's off his rocker!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I have to. I have to know for sure.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But he almost killed you back in the underground, Vina!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Let her do it.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Something's not right with the Steam Knight... Sir Charles. Siege probably sensed it too.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: But—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Trust her.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Vina approaches the Steam Knight. She can feel the temperature rise from the hot steam.
I've never seen you like this, not even back in the Mausoleum of Kings.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The war is over. You've protected Victoria. You've completed your mission.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: (Steam hissing)
attributes.name: Charles Lynch

attributes.content: What are you still searching for? The sword? Sorry. It was lost somewhere on the battlefield.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: (Steam hissing)
attributes.name: Charles Lynch

attributes.content: Or perhaps you're waiting for something else?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina gently touches Sir Charles's armor. Every scratch and mark etched into it tells the Steam Knight's story—
The battle with his comrades on the day he swore to inherit the title.
The battle on the frontier to quell uprisings—he survived amidst a storm of witchcraft.
The betrayal in the Mausoleum of Kings.
The charge towards the Glorious, towards Originium...
Sir Charles Lynch has never fallen.
Sir Charles Lynch shall forever watch over Victoria.
You're looking at the Palace of Westhaleg. I understand now.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You're not the only one. Many more are looking over at the palace.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina looks back at the gathered Victorians in the distance—wounded, silent, excited, weeping...
The people had already formed a long human wall on their own, holding back the restive and agitated crowd.
They are all murmuring different names.
'Siege', 'Vina', 'Alexandrina', 'Victoria'.
(Steam hissing)
attributes.name: Charles Lynch

attributes.content: I never believed you'd gone mad.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Sir Charles, this is our second official meeting.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I once hoped that if you found your way out of the darkness, you would find something worth protecting.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We've already made it this far. Please wait a little longer, until I return.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: (Steam hissing)
attributes.name: Charles Lynch

attributes.content: Vina walks past the Steam Knight, up the steps of the Palace of Westhaleg, and alone through its door.
Time slowly passes.
At first, the crowd is silent, but gradually they stir, as unrest begins to spread.
Why is it taking so long? Could there be other enemies inside?
attributes.name: Voice in the Crowd

attributes.content: Should we go and help?
attributes.name: Voice in the Crowd

attributes.content: Quiet! Have faith in Her Royal Highness Alexandrina!
attributes.name: Voice in the Crowd

attributes.content: Can't you see that even the Steam Knight is waiting here in silence?
attributes.name: Voice in the Crowd

attributes.content: I've heard the crown is still inside. Do you think that when she comes out, we'll have a new King?!
attributes.name: Voice in the Crowd

attributes.content: Something's not right here. Based on our intelligence, there shouldn't be any more of the Military Commission's forces left.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: There should be nothing left in that palace.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Are we just gonna stand here like idiots? We oughta just go in and see for ourselves!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I'll go.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: There are better choices—
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Well, we're the only ones who can drive the Crawler.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: As long as we've got the Crawler, we've nothing to fear. We'll be protected, even against the Steam Knight.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.text: Vina never told us what she saw in the Palace of Westhaleg, and we never asked Feist about it either.
\nIt doesn't matter.
\nI'm just relieved that once the Military Commission's banner fell from atop the Palace, Vina didn't actually walk out wearing the crown.
That's my Vina!
\nAt least, that's how I felt at the time...

attributes.content: There she is! She's coming out!
attributes.name: Voice in the Crowd

attributes.content: Where's the crown? Why isn't she wearing the crown?
attributes.name: Voice in the Crowd

attributes.content: Quiet, you moron! She hasn't been coronated yet. Why would she be wearing the crown already?
attributes.name: Voice in the Crowd

attributes.content: What's that in her hands? Is that the devils' flag?
attributes.name: Voice in the Crowd

attributes.content: Good people of Victoria. The Nachzehrer King is dead.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I have torn down this flag that the enemy has stabbed into the heart of our great Londinium.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We will tear down every Sarkaz banner left in our home and drive out every enemy still consumed by their bloodlust!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But please, spare the unarmed ones. Spare anyone willing to surrender.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The war is over! We must not avenge slaughter with more slaughter, nor meet hatred with more hatred!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I, Vina Victoria, wish to speak to all the heroes who have fought to defend our Victoria.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Hear me. We have liberated Londinium, liberated Victoria!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: In these coming days, months, and years——
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We must revive Victoria! We shall revive Victoria!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina raises her hammer aloft for all to see.
The people rise to their feet, and a wave of cheers spreads outward from the center, each surge louder than the last.
Londinium and her citizens celebrate her rebirth.
At the center of the crowd, the last Steam Knight lets out his final roar, steam bursting forth.
His heart stops beating, so he ignites it with the suit's burning core.
His vision blurs, so he clears it with steam hot enough to melt flesh.
Then, Sir Charles sees it:
Victoria's flag basking in the sun's golden glow.
Sir Charles Lynch can finally fall.
He falls to the light of dawn, to a new beginning.
Steam completely envelops Sir Charles's enormous body, making his demise unceremonious and almost unnoticed.
Amidst the cheering crowd, a figure walks into the cloud of steam. Allerdale bids farewell to the hero she once so deeply admired.
You could have killed me, back then.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: The despicable meeting her end at the hands of her hero... That would have been the perfect ending to her story.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: So why must the despicable be the one to bid farewell to the hero?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Sir Charles, you have completed your mission.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: My father once taught me that every Steam Knight returning triumphantly from his mission would have a squire to remove his armor and wipe away the dust—
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Allow me to remove your armor.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: ...It has long fused with your body.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: 'Core... temperature... dropping'
I will keep your core. I promise that your heart will never stop burning. It will bear witness to Victoria's future.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Sir Charles, you've seen the things you hoped to protect restored to their former brilliance.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Have you any final words, good Steam Knight?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.text: 'From this day forward, you will be honored as a Steam Knight.'
'Sir Charles Lynch, tell me, what do you want for your reward?'
'Your Majesty, I wish for your blade to always be sharp.'
'I wish for the wheat my wife harvests to fill the granary by our doorstep year after year.'
'I wish to hold my newborn daughter in my arms and fly over Londinium, gazing down at the factories bustling day and night throughout the city.'
'I wish for my neighbor, whose legs were crippled by illness, to stand again, so we can drink, sing, and celebrate through the night with our comrades we know so well.'
'Your Majesty, what I wish for is a life of lasting peace. If this reward requires me to fight for it myself...'
'Then, Your Majesty, I pledge to you, I will always keep fighting, for you, for all my loved ones, for myself, and for...'
'...Victoria.'

attributes.content: 'Victoria.'
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: 'The Oath of Sir Charles Lynch, the final words of the last Steam Knight.'
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: You never abandoned yourself, even when Victoria abandoned you...
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Ha... 'Steam Knight', I don't deserve that title, nor this set of armor.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: This war has already claimed too many lives.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I hope yours is the last. Goodbye, Sir Charles Lynch.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Listen. They're all bidding you farewell.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: 'Victoria! Victory!'
'Victoria!' 'For Victoria!!!'
'(last burst of steam)'
'Victoria', his final hoarse whisper merges with the crowd's shouting, like raindrops quietly dropping into the sea.
Allerdale sees the excited faces in the crowd, yet cannot help falling into silence.
Her eyes are drawn to the woman standing on the steps—Vina. She knows Vina can see her as well.
Vina just stands there, looking back at her, her lips moving slightly.
Did she recognize me? Allerdale sighs.
You made the right choice. You are standing exactly where you belong.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: As am I.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Londinium does not need any more heroes, Vina.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: She turns and walks away, disappearing into the white billows of steam.
What are you looking at, Vina?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The Steam Knight is gone. He has completed his mission.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: ——? That steam... I thought it was like last time—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: This time is different.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Then we...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: There is no need to bother him. Someone is already seeing him off.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Celebration, and mourning.
Vina, what should we do next?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The people stand cheering in front of the Palace of Westhaleg. They all look to Vina.
They're waiting for you.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Then I will show them all, Delphine.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: <p=1>The Sineselde, Parliamentary Chamber</><p=2>December 25th, 1098, 5:24 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: ...is this the Speaker's answer? She sent you, her old comrades, to drive us away?
attributes.name: Retired Exemplar

attributes.content: No. Guarding the Sineselde is only one of the Defense Forces' responsibilities. Justice is justice, Hoff.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Heroes shouldn't be treated this way. Diane and all The Exemplars who bled don't deserve this, do they, Commander?
attributes.name: Retired Exemplar

attributes.content: I understand what you're saying, but this isn't how Parliament makes decisions.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We cannot let this become a precedent.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I do not know politics, Captain. I only know that Diane is a good person. If Parliament insists, many hearts will be lost.
attributes.name: Retired Exemplar

attributes.content: And you, sir? You still will not yield?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I know Diane well. She would never act out of selfishness. Nor does she have any ties with the nobility.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Therefore, I humbly ask the Speaker to take time out of her busy schedule to reconsider Diane's verdict.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: This was a decision rendered by the provisional court. Diane broke into the locked throne room in direct defiance of Parliament.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We also know Diane very well, but... I'm afraid there's nothing—
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: —Diane?!
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Yes. She's the one who introduced us to you!
attributes.name: Emotional Worker

attributes.content: After the war, we lost our homes and nearly our lives. If it weren't for her constant encouragement, I'd probably still be passed out in a barrel of ale.
attributes.name: Emotional Worker

attributes.content: You don't think she's a bad person either, do you? It's just that Vina—
attributes.name: Emotional Worker

attributes.content: Speaker Vina, sorry. It's a force of habit. Speaker Vina must have made a mistake.
attributes.name: Emotional Worker

attributes.content: We've all gone to her office, but I feel like just having numbers on our side might not be enough... Feist, your words carry more weight—please, I'm begging you.
attributes.name: Emotional Worker

attributes.content: Sorry, but I have to assume that if Parliament put Diane on trial, they must have also allowed her to present a defense.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: No matter how strange or unfair I think their decision is, having Speaker Vina force them to change it at the last minute would be even more unfair.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: But Diane's case should be treated differently. We just barely survived the war, and now she's going to die over something so stupid?
attributes.name: Emotional Worker

attributes.content: Listen to the radio. Listen to the patrons in the bars. You'll hear that nobody's happy about this decision.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: What do you think, Catherine? You said we could lodge our complaints with Vina anytime.
attributes.name: Elderly Worker

attributes.content: I think Diane is just a stupid girl who did a stupid thing. Nothing more.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: She means well, but what she did was moronic. She defied a direct order of Parliament and left Vina with no other choice.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: So, you're planning to turn down the pharma rep?
attributes.name: Elderly Worker

attributes.content: How do you expect me to convince Parliament?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Actually, Vina does have a chance to solve this. With her reputation, persuading Parliament to impose a lighter punishment is not impossible.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: But many eyes are watching as she makes her final decision.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: This is just one of the many tricky issues that the Speaker of Londinium's Parliament has to face. A hero may be able to save everyone in a war, but...
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: —Lady Delphine.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: We spent quite a bit of time trying to find you.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Me?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: In just one day, Diane's case caused quite an uproar across Londinium. We briefly investigated who was spreading the news and inciting the public.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: So... Parliament wants me to shut up.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: No, Eliseo. Compared to deliberate acts of sabotage, your actions have had significantly less impact.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Actually, we all admire you for fighting so hard for someone you have not known for very long.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Vina understands how you feel. She wanted to come see you in person, but I stopped her.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I apologize, but Madame Speaker has more urgent matters to attend to presently.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Is there... absolutely no room for negotiation regarding Diane's case?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: No. Vina could change things. We all know that.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Frankly, this is a very sad case. However, it will serve as a message from Parliament to all the citizens.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I saw that you requested to review Parliament's records, so you must be well aware of Diane's charges, the defense that she herself presented, and the various PMs' opinions of her.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The citizenry has collectively established Londinium's current laws, and the provisional court made its judgment of Diane in accordance with those laws. Isn't this how you do things in Columbia?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But she's a war hero—shouldn't her merits outweigh her faults?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: That's a notion steeped in reason, yet brimming with arrogance.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I often come across this phrase in history books, usually said by old Victorian kings.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But if Vina crosses this line and the others allow it to happen, then what is the point of having Parliament?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: How would our Parliament be any different from the one where the king himself served as Speaker?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I don't know the answer to that question, Eliseo, but none of us want to take the risk of finding out.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Parliament will not interfere with any of your endeavors. However, as far as Diane's case is concerned, I'm sorry—this is Parliament's decision, and it cannot be changed.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Diane never told me, specifically, what kind of soldier she was during the war. Most of the time, she talked to me about her hopes for Londinium's future.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Most of the people I meet in Londinium harbor high hopes and dreams for the city's future.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: This is the city's great fortune. Our duty is to ensure we never let its people down.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I see.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: The herbs Diane grew in the greenhouse against all odds will mature in February. I hear they can alleviate the excruciating pain of Oripathy.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I'll wait until they mature and take some samples back to Columbia.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Okay. If you need any help before then, just let us know.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Actually, when I first arrived in Londinium, I was also curious as to what kind of person Speaker Vina was...
attributes.name: Faraway Voice

attributes.text: When Hannah and I visit schools and sanatoriums to give 'surprises' to the Infected children, they always ask us about 'the story of Princess Alexandrina, the Princess Royal.'
\nWe then tell them the whole tale of the street urchin who became a legendary war hero and the savior of Londinium.
\nBut the story always ends when Vina walks out of the Palace of Westhaleg. At that point, it's not so fit for children.
How I wish the story could end with Vina tearing off those fancy clothes and returning with us to Norport, to the Glasgow Gang.
\nBut I know that's not possible anymore.

\nOn the day of the mass protests against Diane's verdict, Vina explained to us, in detail, the proposals she was going to submit to the dukes at her upcoming meeting. They covered a whole lot of topics like food, healthcare, education, and civil service reforms.
Vina had the right solutions to all of those issues, but she didn't say a word about Diane.
\nWe listened quietly to all of her proposals and then left without bringing it up.

attributes.content: Fuel inventory report... Comprehensive report on all city sanatoriums... Report on Oripathy suppressant distribution...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina returns her gaze to the documents in front of her. She struggles to absorb the reams of data.
She knows that in just a few minutes, the bell on the table will ring to remind her to head to the banquet hall.
She also knows that those guests don't truly care about the numbers she has tried to memorize, much less the actual lives, deaths, and hardships they represent.
But she cares. This time she's the one who invited the dukes for dinner.
I hope this works.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: In the now-quiet office, the faint shouts of protesters outside the window could still be heard.
...I'm sorry, Diane.
attributes.name: Vina
